right here at home.

4317.text:
Who do you think would
be the best nominee?

4320.text:
Oh, I don't-- I'm not going
to get into that right now.

4329.text: Who do you see who's running--

4331.text:
But what is interesting
to me is that we

4333.text:
had a lineup of almost a dozen
of the all star governors.

4339.text:
Every one of them on the
cover of Time or Newsweek,

4341.text:
the new face of the Republican
Party, the future of America.

4345.text:
And each one of
them, one by one,

4349.text:
It's the most incredible
thing I've ever seen.

4352.text:
So the top 10 people
who folks thought

4355.text:
were going to be the
future of the party--

4356.text:
So if we had this
conversation a year ago,

4359.text:
and I said the
nominee of our party

4361.text:
will be a guy who
lives on Fifth Avenue

4363.text:
in a gold plated apartment,

4368.text:
News, and calling out
it's beloved evening

4372.text:
correspondent by name and by
Twitter, and a recent convert,

4376.text:
to all things, conservatism,
you would have said,

4378.text:
you're smoking something they

4386.text:
That's what makes
it so interesting.

4387.text:
So let me close on this and
tie these two threads together.

4390.text:
Whoever's the next President
of the United States,

4392.text:
what advice would you
give him or her about

4398.text:
and building a stronger
relationship between the two

4405.text:
There's no such thing as a

4407.text:
And I would say, just
generally, like the note

4413.text:
I left when I
departed as governor,

4417.text:
I was asked by a President
not of my political party

4419.text:
who used to teach at this very

4423.text:
I wrote a note for my lieutenant
governor, who was then

4428.text:
And I said the only
advice I give you is this.

4432.text:
The 1% of our state, they have
lobbyists here on Capitol Hill,

4438.text:
And they've got people
who can troubleshoot

4440.text:
tax policy and land policy
and everything else.

4444.text:
But the 99% of the other

4448.text:
You are that person, so take
the time to listen and transcend

4455.text:
any governor, any
executive, any head of state

4459.text:
And I think we need to see

4462.text:
Well, Governor
Huntsman, thank you so

Thank you again so much and
